title: N04-1022

sentences.text: We present Minimum Bayes-Risk -LRB- MBR -RRB- decoding for statistical machine translation .
This statistical approach aims to minimize expected loss of translation errors under loss functions that measure translation performance .

We describe a hierarchy of loss functions that incorporate different levels of linguistic information from word strings , word-to-word alignments from an MT system , and syntactic structure from parse-trees of source and target language sentences .
We report the performance of the MBR decoders on a Chinese-to-English translation task .
Our results show that MBR decoding can be used to tune statistical MT performance for specific loss functions .

summary: We present Minimum Bayes-Risk -LRB- MBR -RRB- decoding for statistical machine translation . This statistical approach aims to minimize expected loss of translation errors under loss functions that measure translation performance . We describe a hierarchy of loss functions that incorporate different levels of linguistic information from word strings , word-to-word alignments from an MT system , and syntactic structure from parse-trees of source and target language sentences . We report the performance of the MBR decoders on a Chinese-to-English translation task . Our results show that MBR decoding can be used to tune statistical MT performance for specific loss functions .

Predicate-present.label: present
Predicate-present.description: The predicate 'present' indicates that the subject is introducing or offering something, often an idea, concept, or explanation. It suggests a sense of bringing forth or making available to others what was previously unknown or unarticulated.

Predicate-describe.label: describe
Predicate-describe.description: To describe means to convey or express information about something, typically providing details and characteristics that help understand its nature, structure, or essence. The predicate 'describe' connects the subject (the entity doing the describing) with an object (what is being described), implying a process of articulating, defining, or explaining the properties, features, or relationships of the object.

Predicate-incorporate.label: incorporate
Predicate-incorporate.description: To integrate or combine two entities (subject and object), typically involving a process of assimilation, absorption, or unification. This predicate suggests that the subject takes in or absorbs some aspect of the object, resulting in a new whole or entity.

Predicate-report.label: report
Predicate-report.description: To report means to convey or communicate information about something, often with the intention of sharing knowledge, findings, or results. The subject reports on the object, providing an account or summary of its characteristics, performance, or outcomes.

Predicate-perform_on_a_task.label: perform on a task
Predicate-perform_on_a_task.description: The predicate 'perform on a task' indicates that the subject entity executes or carries out an action related to the object, which represents a specific task or function. This connection implies that the subject has the capability and intention to accomplish the task described by the object.

Predicate-show_that.label: show that
Predicate-show_that.description: The predicate 'show that' indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object, suggesting that the subject provides evidence or proof for the truth of the statement expressed by the object. In other words, it implies that the subject demonstrates or illustrates the validity of the claim made in the object.

Predicate-can_be_used_to_tune.label: can be used to tune
Predicate-can_be_used_to_tune.description: This predicate indicates that the subject has a functional relationship with the object, where the subject's purpose or capability enables the tuning of the object. In general, it suggests an instrumental role for the subject in achieving some desired state or performance level related to the object.

Predicate-for_specific_loss_functions.label: for specific loss functions
Predicate-for_specific_loss_functions.description: The predicate 'for specific loss functions' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject's value or quality is determined by its compatibility with one or more specific types of loss functions. This connection suggests that the subject's performance, characteristics, or outcomes are influenced by the particular loss functions used to evaluate it.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is related to or encompasses the object through a more general concept. This relationship suggests that the subject has a higher-level category, class, or abstraction that includes the object as one of its instances.
